column4: hi. thunderbird isn't finding my account files. Thankfully its there but on start up it opens the usual 'create email account' dialog
is this common?
when you first start, yeah.. but there's a way of setting your old profile as the default
so you don't haev to do that
this isn't my first start. it just started doing this.
if you look at thunderbird help, there should be a thing on migration
first start on a new OS/program/whatever
nope!
i've done it myself
it was working fine on feisty the day before. Nothing was installed in the time in between. Perhaps a file was corrupted and thunderbird chokes on my dafault account?
http://www.mozilla.org/support/thunderbird/faq.html#profilemanager ... so what is that then?
you need to transfer the profile you've been using to the equivalent place, and then run the profile manager and change it so that the profile you transfered is the default
the two questions at the top of that link will cover everything you need to know
you misunderstand. I haven't migrated anything. profiles.ini points to the same one it did yesterday, when it loaded it fine. thanks though.
so what's the problem?
thunderbird *suddenly* will not open the default profile folder.
does it open the others?
i only have one profile
well make one and see. it could be that the main one is corrupted. i'm sure it can be fixed somehow. don't know personally
thanks for trying to help :)
you could try making a new one, and then transferring all the files into that profile. not sure if that works, but it's also worth a try
but my guess is that one of your files has broken
outside of all that you'll have to go through the thunderbird support pages (it would HAVE to be in there somewhere), or maybe someone else can help.. but you're probably in the wrong channel
